name: closefriend
text: I too use Mexican magical realism as a scapegoat for my lack of getting laid.

name: dusty
text: It doesn't hurt your love life as bad as Polish Magical Nihilism.

name: soticoto
text: Is that where you take a photo of yourself, and when you look at it, it turns black and you fall into it and nobody ever remembers you existed?

name: dusty
text: That sounds like exactly what it would do, yes.

name: petro
text: A comment left by petro was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by TripperDay, Norsef, SSDDR, Courtland, Kleptonis, atticusonline, TTAGXAMM, dracer2, STUART, Archon_Divinus)

name: donsoze
text: It is my personal feeling that the tale of the teeth examinin' dude beats out both the Raining RV and Rock Hard Cat Cock as best Mexican Magical Realism ever.

name: crinklebat
text: As far as I'm concerned, there could be an entire spinoff strip with examples of Mexican magical realism, and I would read it every single day. Or die trying.

name: audhumla
text: Someone's gotta hook Gabriel García Márquez with Illustrator, a tablet, and the internet immediately. That would be super.

name: onepapertiger
text: good call--I just finished "Chronicle of a Death Foretold" for a Class, fucking ridiculous ending to a ridiculous story. ("Ridiculous" = incredible)

name: ttagxamm
text: The real danger of course is that Mexican Magic Realism will be crossbred with Borgesian Paradox, and that the resulting Argentinized hybrid will spread inexorably northward, overwhelming us with infinite libraries, inexplicable games of chance, maps that unfold to cover the entirety of the territory they represent...

name: cailetshadow
text: ..and killer bees.

name: contrasoma
text: Oh, how I wish I could double-chubby this comment.

name: housewife
text: I know a lady in San Francisco who has that post-horn tattooed on her wrist

name: thumb
text: Is already happened, dude. That's where Doctor Who came from.

name: bovine
text: brunina de nada. haha hilarious

name: clockworkorange
text: is that middle of nowhere? i know basically no Spanish, but that's my intuitive guess.

name: karljw
text: wordref tells me "brunina" actually means something like darkness or shadow, so i'd translate it "the shadow of nothingness"

name: foxtrotamend
text: Everyone could use more "Mexican Magical Realism"

name: falseprophet
text:
It deeply saddens me that the cat who demolished the foundational precepts of the Great Outdoor Fight failed to find his true love because of a stop light.

That was the test, Ray. That was the magical realist test. How could you fail?

name: achilleselbow
text: You really think he would've found true love? The whole setup of the thing seems to me like there'd be no cars around for miles, but the moment he tried to run the light, he'd get hit by a truck that came out of nowhere and vanished immediately afterward. The police examining the scene would remark that this was the same spot where an attractive Latina woman was hit by a truck as she was preparing to leave for her wedding exactly 20 years ago.

name: falseprophet
text:
Ahhh, you make an excellent point. I had not considered the possibility that the Latina woman would be from ...

Backstory!

name: puguglypress
text: man when did magical mexican realism turn into goosebumps

name: godfatherofsouls
text: Ray do get bored in the flat field.

name: morypcaina
text: IN THE FLAT FIE-EE-EE-EE-EEEELD!!!

name: possums
text: I want to know how Borges feels about this.

name: boredom_man
text:
Cold. So very, very cold.

Anyway, I think there is more magic realism coming out of Mexico than Argentina or the US, and that no knock to Borges or Ellison is necessary to parody that fact.

name: karljw
text: Not to be a literary pedant, but Borges doesn't fit under most definitions of magical realism.

name: zeal
text: Before Achewood I never even knew about Mexican Magical Realism, as a literary device or otherwise.  But now, man.  But now.

name: xiaomimi
text:

Roast Beef: Man I am over a dog about car things
Lyle: crap did i shoot the dude
Onstad: My heritage changed.

"its the worst sfeelin in theworld not to knwo if yuo shot a dude"

name: tekende
text: "If you were to look at me, which you can't, because I don't like that sort of thing,"

name: envika
text: i like to picture the dude on the other line pronouncing "hecho" like "HET-cho", not "ET-cho"

name: atticusonline
text: Well Ray is certainly saying "Het-cho"

name: tekende
text: I've been pronouncing it "hay-cho" in my head.

name: spicyponyhead
text: O shit, is that how it's supposed to be?

name: fancyrat
text: What the hell is panel eight?

name: tekende
text: Two vehicles at an intersection in the middle of nowhere. Are you blind? Do you need me to type this in wingdings font?

name: fancypants
text: hilarious

name: mashisoyo
text: As if assetbar would correctly display wingdings.
